website_summaries.verdict: This colorful toy is fun and educational, and an affordable option that will encourage preschool-aged Sesame Street fans to play and learn.
pros: Has all of the letters of the alphabet in bright colors set in a cute Elmo-themed carrying case that keeps pieces organized
Graphics that include other popular Sesame Street characters inspire kids to learn
Suitable for ages 2 to 4 years old
cons: Some letters are more difficult than others to snap in or take out of designated slots
Some youngsters found it difficult to open the case, but were still enthused about the toy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for 2 and under
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old kid got frustrated because it's too hard to take the Letters Out. I loosen some of them for him. I had to return it. Otherwise the quality is good not cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: sheba

customer_reviews.title: good concept but design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept, but the letters are hard to take out even for an adult. I understand the letters have to snap in tightly so that when you close it up, they stay in place, but my almost 2yo constantly likes putting them in and taking them out, which means it's not a toy they can play with by themselves yet. The letter "Q" is the most difficult to snap in and take out! Also, when you close up the briefcase, it's even hard for me to open it back up. I also wish the entire thing was about 25% smaller. It is much too big to be played with on a 2yo's lap.
customer_reviews.author: NX

customer_reviews.title: This thing has brought a lot of fun to my 2yo
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my kids 2nd birthday. At 1st my 2 yo played with it correctly for 3 months. Shouting the letter and the picture of the slot "A is for abby!" As he popped the letter in the slot. Now he is obsessed with "M" and "W". Then he hides the letters in random spots around the living room. A few of them have gone missing because of this. Any way. This is by far his favorite birthday gift. He wakes up talking about "playing letters" and "needs to find m and w" It's a really fun alphabet game
customer_reviews.author: Bri D

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those weird parents who rarely allows her child screen time. In fact, my daughter is only allowed a few minutes of Sesame Street songs on YouTube, while I clip her nails. One of the songs that she watches is the Sesame Street Alphabet, and although this toy isn't a perfect match to the song, it's close enough that I could sing the song, with a few modifications, while we did this puzzle. My daughter, who is not even 2, can complete this puzzle by herself now, and was recently given a different alphabet puzzle, which she immediately completed independently, as well. So, surprisingly awesome toy!
customer_reviews.author: SDGood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for learning ABC's
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES Elmo and all things Sesame Street, so when I saw this I knew it would be a winner. The suitcase is great for home and car, we've even taken it on the plane a couple of times! While the case itself is not hard for a toddler to open, she does have a hard time getting some of the letters out without help...I'm hoping that they will loosen some over time. This has really helped with learning the alphabet and the photos behind the letters are a nice touch for learning words. We haven't really used the open space to spell, but I anticipate we will in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Noel Powers

customer_reviews.title: ... moment I opened this one my 23 month old LOVED this set
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I opened this one my 23 month old LOVED this set. Its a great set to have. NO BATTERIES to replace, NO NOISES, NO LIGHTS, but just good old fashion fun. My son will pass many loud and bright exiting toys to pick this case up and bring to me to open which I love because we can sit together and identify all the letters of alphabet and practice words. Highly recommend to any parent by 18 months as this was the age my son stopped putting everything straight to his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nicer if it was electronic
customer_reviews.text: This is not an electronic toy. Of course I didn’t realize but it should be. You should pop the letters in and it should say the letter. I kept it but it is not really doing much except being a puzzle at this point. I wanted it to help teach my child his letters but without sound it doesn’t work that way. Also the clasp is really hard to open. The goodness about that is it doesn’t fall open and spill the pieces but seriously I struggle opening it. The only feature I like is that the letters click into place and stay so it is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for learning the alphabet and matching shapes
customer_reviews.text: Simple and durable toy for babies and toddlers. Plastic case and the pieces are large and durable, so there is no choking hazard for very young kids. Colors are bright, and decorated with Sesame Street characters. It s great toy that both kids and adults will enjoy playing together and learn ABCs. I deducted one star because the 1st set I bought was missing a letter "W", and instead had an extra "M". I had it exchanged, so not a huge deal, but this is something that needs to caught during product QC.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddlers interested in the alphabet
customer_reviews.text: My two-year-old loves this! She recently turned two and already knows most of her letters, and loves playing with this. She will ask me where letters go even though she already knows, it's really cute. It won't really teach them anything on their own though, you'll need to play with them and get them familiar with the letters. It's basically just a puzzle unless you interact and make it a game! My only qualm is that it won't close unless the letters are in their spots, so no quick clean up if the letters are loose.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: My son has severe autism and intellectual disability and is a sensory explorer which means he's everywhere, and chews/mouths everything! He loves ABC puzzles, but they are usually made of wood that he chews and they often get lost. This has been a godsend for us and him. He loves it and carries around his little brief case. He's able to easily remove and pop in letters, and open and shut the case. I wish there was more puzzles like this, it just makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy loves Elmo and we're working on the ABC's and colors so I was excited when I found this! BUT the latches that open and close the case make difficult for even me to open let alone a 2 year old. Also, the letters snap in pretty tightly making it hard for him to pull them out unless he gets it just right. No sounds which is a plus in my book and there is a little spot for spelling out short words but it doesn't make up for the functionality. Also, there are about two dozen visible screws that aren't really a problem but esthetically makes it look really cheap.
customer_reviews.author: HSell14

customer_reviews.title: Durable puzzle!
customer_reviews.text: We love this! This is my third Elmo letters to buy. My youngest daughter is nonverbal and has autism. This puzzle helps her build fine motor and cognitive skills. Plus the letters are large so no choking hazard (or chewing issues). At first, the letters are tight and can be difficult to remove or put back in; but after a few times, they loosen up. We all celebrated when she finally did the puzzle independently!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn H.

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: The case is very hard to open. If I have issues with it imagine how hard it is for a toddler. My bf has me order this for our two year old after seeing it on YouTube. I was familiar with it bc my goddaughter had it 4 years ago. When it arrived my bf wasn’t impressed lol he thought it made noise or lite up, you know something exciting. He was so disappointed lol. Our son likes carrying it around the house lol. Idk why that empty box is there, it’s only so many words you can spell.
customer_reviews.author: JestJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: My 3yr old loves this set and can easily get the letters out and in. It’s simple and does not offer any sound or electronic feature. But it gets the job done and my son knows all of his letters. This would probably be best for toddlers that are well on their way to learning their letters rather than using to teach the letters. But maybe not? 🤷🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Groulx

customer_reviews.title: Warped box and water damage
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea, but it looks like it has water damage-both the box and the background photos where the letters go. It's a little hard to see all the warped areas in photos, but you get the idea. Trying to decide if I should replace it. My daughter loves it already, but I hate that I paid full price for something damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Love that these come in a case so you don't end up with letters everywhere after putting them away. Cute Sesame Street images. The letters seem durable. My only complaint is that they're pretty hard to take out. My little one (and sometimes myself) have a difficult time pulling some of the letters out. I have to pop each one out before letting her play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Crista C.

customer_reviews.title: The best learning toy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids favorite toy!!! People have written that it’s not for toddlers cause it’s too hard and I couldn’t disagree more. My kids since they were 12-15 months were obsessed with this toy and the Cookie Monster one. By 18 months they both knew all the letters and loved playing with this. Since it’s a case we take it on all our trips! It’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Best alphabet learner out there!!
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST alphabet puzzle out there. Leyters click easily into place and are secure for case closing, the letters are big enough for easy handling, and m daughter loves to carry the case to bring the letters with. No more throwing letters elsewhere and losing them. This toy will last and letters will not be lost!! I definitely recommend this over any letter learning toys or flash cards. I know. I've tried them.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: 21 month old loves it! Simple toy with various ways to play
customer_reviews.text: Great for letters, colors, spelling, motor skills. My 21 month old loves it and asks for his "Elmo book" multiple times a day. Someone recommended it as a good toy for learning letters, and it definitely is. It is hard to open, but I don't mind that because that also means its won't easily open in the car, etc. and is a great toy to take along on visits with family, etc. where you don't know if they have toys that your little one would like. Some of the letters click better than others, so for overall quality I knocked off a star, but my son loves it and for the price, I think the quality is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin H Ashton

customer_reviews.title: My 2 yr old loves this
customer_reviews.text: This toy despite being very simple. It plays no music, has no flashing lights, etc. Is a huge hit in my house. My 2 year old son loves calling out the letters before he pulls them out of the box, or puts them back. I docked a star only because it's hard to open, even for my husband and I. One of us always has to help our son open it. Otherwise this is a great educational toy that he actually wants to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Candydiva04

customer_reviews.title: Buy it elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This has to be a joke. It came missing letters and with double of others. The edge that would normally hold the pieces in are broken and sharp. NOT safe for little fingers!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Davey

customer_reviews.title: HARD for little ones to open!
customer_reviews.text: Love the product but super hard for little ones to open! My 2 year old gets so frustrated trying to open this toy by herself (she can't). She enjoys playing with the letters and working on her ABCs. Seems very durable and will last a long time. We use this in the car as it's compact and easy for little laps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sesame Street Elmo's On The Go Letters
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old grandson absolutely loves this ABC puzzle type of learning toy. The fact that it is self contained is practical and useful. He has a lot of fun playing and showing the letters. The letters if pressed on click into their matching spaces so they don't roll around. This is a great gift and an excellent hands-on learning tool/toy.
customer_reviews.author: kathi s.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a solid, mobile alphabet that would hold my 2 year olds attention. I’m so happy I took a chance on this set. Each letter has a slot that allows you to lift up and out of its designated space. Each letter clicks into place so it’s super easy to travel with, without concern you’ll open the case to letters everywhere. Super durable and the colors are very vibrant. Has become my child’s go to toy for the alphabet, after countless alphabet blocks, foam alphabets etc... Will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: By Odins Beard

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy with easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old has been working on his alphabet and loves Elmo so this toy seemed perfect. It was! The letters can easily be snapped into their designated spot and won't fall out. It's not magnetic which I thought would be a problem but since they snap in, it's fine. The letters are large too, so he can take them out and play with them without the case if he wants to. He has played with it for hours already!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: satisfying
customer_reviews.text: my daughter is not yet two and can generally take the letters out and put them back. she loves container play and this toy meets that criteria for us. it also generates a lot of language as you can discuss color, letter sounds, etc. the sensory input of returning the letter to the case is really pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Karosen

customer_reviews.title: The carrying case makes it for easy clean up and storage. Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gift for our 18 month old grandson. They make a lot of car trips and this toy comes in a case that holds all the letters in. So when he is done playing - and learning his alphabet - it’s very easy to put away and store any where in the car because it is so compact!
customer_reviews.author: Patee Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this for my son who was 18 months at the time. My son is now 3 1/1 and he still loves and plays with this. He now loves to spell out words. I now buy this as a gift when I go to birthday parties. I just saw the cookie monster one with numbers and have just bought it to surprise my son. To say he loves this is an understatement. My son LOVES his letters. If your child loves ABC's its a must buy
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Color and Fun activity
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old, and we keep it in the car for restaurants and other places we need quiet(er) time. He enjoys saying the letter and matching them with the cute sesame street character graphics behind the letters. Super colorful, and it stores nicely. The letters stay put when the case is closed, so your not dealing with a mess when you open it. Great learning tool!
customer_reviews.author: Dumna MaMa

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Didn’t really read the description before I bought it, I thought it was going to get another noise maker but it’s soft plastic! Big letters & they click down go it can really be on the go without letters falling everywhere! Perfect. Love love love.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Lots of play options
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our restaurant bag....keeps our 2yo busy matching colors and talking about pictures and making letter sounds. The letters are difficult to pop out, so adult assistance is required. Easy to pack away when the food comes. We purchased this one and the numbers one and we like this (letters) one the best
customer_reviews.author: Thirtysomething. Working Mom of 2 two-and-under.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing my 2 year old watch youtube videos of other children playing with it. For some reason I thought the letters were magnets, which they are not. They do pop in and out pretty easily, though. My 2 year old loves playing with this and discovering the characters underneath each letter. I gave it 4 stars because the case itself can be difficult to open without an adult. Otherwise great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zebley

customer_reviews.title: Great but wouldn't recommend for under 2
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy but she struggles to both open the case and to grab the letters. I have difficulty myself with taking the letters out. Otherwise, my daughter loves to play with this toy and it's great that they stay compact in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Antionette

customer_reviews.title: Not the best!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it because it’s Elmo. The letters are supposed to click into place. They stopped doing that within the first couple days of owning this. If my daughter didn’t love carrying it around I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Tyner

customer_reviews.title: Toddler approved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son since my niece and nephew loved theirs. My 18 month old toddler loves this, especially since it has Elmo on it. He can carry it to you and make you play and it keeps his interest for longer than most toys.
customer_reviews.author: Beth S

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY! 👍
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO BUY EARLY MY DAUGHTER IS 1YR OLD AND SHE LOVES THIS LEARNING TOY AND KNOWS HER ABC'S! SHE PLAYS WITH THIS EVERYDAY! I EVEN WENT AND BOUGHT THE COOKIE MONSTER NUMBER ONE:-) IT'S AN EXCELLENT LEARNING TOOL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes Learning Fun
customer_reviews.text: These a great for kids to play with at home. Nice case to keep them in when not being used. Wouldn’t recommend for travel only because the letters are loose and could end up scattered everywhere. My great-grands love playing with these and are so proud when they can name the letters as well as the colors the letters are...makes learning fun.
customer_reviews.author: 2yax2go

customer_reviews.title: Great 2nd birthday present
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son's 2nd birthday. He already knows his letters but this definitely helps reinforce that information. We've had it over a month now and he still plays with it daily. At first the letters were a bit difficult for him to take out on his own but after showing him where the notches are he's able to take them out by himself with no problems. You do have to make sure the letters are all pushed in before closing it up, otherwise they fall and you can't close it. We would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Miklos

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: My son loved these. He already knew his alphabet but this helped him to visually be able to see what goes where and put them there himself. I love that they stay no place and are easy to remove and put back. He is 3 now and says that this is his tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne W.

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 years old son loved it
customer_reviews.text: Really good learning toy for for kids. My 2.5 year old boy loved it. Every time he hear alphabet rhymes, he brings this toy and play with it. Quality is great and durable. However it is not easy to open storage box and remove some alphabets for younger kids but that's not problem at least our case our son, he is more engaged when play with his brother or mother or with me. He recognized letters and say it loud to get our confirmation that he got it right :-).
customer_reviews.author: Lale

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler toy!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is 2 and loves the alphabet. We got him this and it has provided tons of joy. At first he had a little trouble getting the letters out. Now he rips them out no problem. The case is too hard to open by himself. Doesn't matter anyways - he is always playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: AngelaLinnae

customer_reviews.title: Amazing learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! My 2 year old loves playing with this! One of her favorite toys! We got it for her several months before she turned 2 and she knew most of her letters within just a few days! This was her first time being introduced to learning her letters! Diff with the money for entertainment AND learning!
customer_reviews.author: Adepino

customer_reviews.title: Cute but makes clean up tough
customer_reviews.text: So this is a good idea in theory, I just wish the box was slightly larger. The problem is, unless the letters are all in the exactly the last right spot, it will not close. As a parent, we don’t always have time to put everything back right away, so that’s my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: JAR1599

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2yr old son for Christmas. I was pretty disappointed. Nothing about this keeps his attention. I feel like it should make some kind if noise or light up. Something. I do not recommend this for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Brazell

customer_reviews.title: Neatly stored and portable. Toddler likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for toddlers. My daughter who is 2 really likes this toy. She likes that the box has a handle and can carry it around. She doesn't know her alphabet yet but can recognize some of the pictures of the letters. As other reviews have stated, it's a little tough to pull out the letters but it's not a huge deal. It's great that everything can be neatly stored and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: Although the child I purchased this for loves the toy, it was shipped with two of the letter X and was missing the letter S. I was very disappointed as this was a birthday present. Embarrassing.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Son loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: 2 yr old loves to play with this toy. We made up songs to go along with toy and it’s helping him learn letters. Wished they would have used common things to help with speech. For example, instead of drums on letter D it should have been a duck? Instead of horse on letter H it could be a HIppo ? Instead of Cookie on C perhaps a car? Just familiar things toddlers see.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: After seeing a celebrity promote this for her son I searched high and low trying to find one for my 2 year old. Very lacklustre and he doesn’t like it. I thought it spoke and lit up but it’s literally letters in a hard to open case. I will saw shipping was quick
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy
customer_reviews.text: Well made and durable. My one year old and three year old both love this character, puzzle toy. My three year old already recites her alphabet and it is nice to have a toy to identify the letters. Portable and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah99

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alphabet case
customer_reviews.text: I love this game for my 2-year-old. Of course she loves Elmo but I love that it doesn’t have sound so it is easy to take it to quiet places like church, hospital, etc. or just helps keeping us sane. The carrying case is awesome! Inevitably we already lost the “O” so I wish you could somehow buy lost letters but that would count as user error not manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: deardani

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My two year old son loves these! I love them even more because there is no noise associated with them. :-) There are cute pictures underneath each letter which makes it fun. The only part I guess I could complain about is my son can’t open the case himself - so look at that as a good or bad thing...you decide!
customer_reviews.author: Liana Kurka

customer_reviews.title: A little tough
customer_reviews.text: I like these letters a lot, and I appreciate that they don't just fall out of place. But some of them are so hard to get out that my 2-year-old can't pull them out at all. In general, they are fun and engaging though.
customer_reviews.author: N. Gailey

customer_reviews.title: great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this toy, he asks for it everyday. it keeps him occupied for some time so I can get a few things done around the house ( more like wash a few dishes) LOL and he is able to identify most of the letters at 2 y/o. Would definitely repurchase as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette

customer_reviews.title: Educational Toy - Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for something to refresh my recollection of the ABC's. Thankfully someone put Elmo's face on a suitcase full of letters, and I was instantly hooked. Now I can get all the way to P without my wife helping! Hooked on Phonics worked for me! Oh, and my 18 month old loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: JimboSlice82

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for a 2 year old.
customer_reviews.text: It’s convenient that you can store this easily and take it on the go but the letters are hard for my nephew to get in and out. The case itself is hard for a child to open on their own. If it didn’t have Elmo on it we would have sent it out to donate it by now. He’s almost 2, maybe this would be better for an older child.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Latch is so hard to unlock for kids & for parents
customer_reviews.text: It's a good quality but too hard to open even for me as a parent. I had a hard time opening it everytime. I had to always open it for my 2 kids. It doesn't encourage independence to my kids. But will still keep it because my kids enjoys playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Marian Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I love that the letters really clip into place. My 2yo can get them all in and out no problem. It’s just letters that clip into place. No batteries no sounds. For me it replaces the obnoxious Leap Frog magnetic set.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Teaching Toddler ABCs
customer_reviews.text: My 2 1/2 year old absolutely loves this. It is a bit difficult to open up, but that's the only complaint. It is very good quality, and she loves sitting down to pop the letters out and attempt to place them back in the appropriate spots. Since it is in a carrying-case, it is perfect for travel and doesn't take up much room. She loves Elmo, so this was perfect for her to practice her ABC's.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Super Cool
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift for my 18 Month old Granddaughter who just freaks out every time she hears elmo or see's him. This is going to be great under the christmas tree and what a great price as well. I love how the letters lock in place since she has had a fascination with that kind of thing to its going to be a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: RocknRoxy

customer_reviews.title: great gift
customer_reviews.text: bought for my 1yr old grandbaby she loves it but her sister loves it even more. i wanted them both to learn their letters and they love playing with it my 2yr old grandbaby pretends she is going to school. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy J

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PUZZLE!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter doesn't like Elmo but we all love this puzzle. I love that the letters click in and stay put and that it turns into anadorable carrying case. She has worked on letters and colors and matching with this!
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: My two year old adores this. She is speech delayed and so I like that she can hold each letter in her hand as we sing the alphabet. They connect to the board and pull apart easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chris&kayla

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves this and so does his cousin. Great learning tool. On the downside the tabs on the top to open it are hard to do for even me, impossible for my little one to open. Even knowing that I gave it a five star because of how much this toy is loved and played with. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Burkett

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product and a great value. It is well made and colorful. My daughter loves to carry it around like a little briefcase then sit with me and play and learn. It offered you opportunities to help you teach your little one the alphabet and more. A great gift too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but hard to take out
customer_reviews.text: This is cute but the letters are really hard to take out and the carrier is even harder to open. I actually struggle to open it every time. My son loves it so that’s all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Numbers are great, Cookies are a waste.
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the letters and the numbers sets for my toddler son. He quickly figured out how to remove both the numbers and the letters. However the cookies are impossible for him to remove. As an adult they are difficult for me to remove! This is a poor design and thus wastes half of the teaching ability of the toy.
customer_reviews.author: SDK

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The kids I work with love alphabet letters so this set was a big hit. It is very sturdy. The kid have stepped on it and thrown it around but it still looks great. No cracks either!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute toy to help teach my son the alphabet. It is annoying that the suit case is difficult for me to open. Its impossible for my son to open.
customer_reviews.author: Alex & Candy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome traveling puzzle
customer_reviews.text: Every toddler should have an alphabet puzzle. What I love about this one is that it comes in a carrying case so the puzzle pieces are out of the way after playtime. It is an Elmo motif and what kid does not love Elmo. It looks sturdy and it is super cute.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Favre-Felix

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for one year old
customer_reviews.text: Our friends have this for their daughters and our one year old was obsessed with it on our beach trip. We decided to buy one for her and she has not stopped playing with it. It is definitely a "one toy at a time" toy due to all of the pieces. The letters are easy for her to pop out on her own and she can carry it around when it is closed.
customer_reviews.author: KE52

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic - She Loves it
customer_reviews.text: Love - She knows all of her letters. She can pull them out and put them back. The bright colors make them stand out where ever she puts them inside and outside.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: She immediately loved it right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Toddler plays with these regularly. After two times, she was able to do them all by herself. The suitcase wont slam on her fingers because its equipped with a hinge that closes very slowly. She immediately loved it right out of the box. Would reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grand daughter whom is 28 months old and she loves it. The letters snap into place and the case is sturdy. Just the right size for her to carry around. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna J. Wertz

customer_reviews.title: My daughter’s favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is obsessed with these and learned all letters by age 2! She wakes up and asks for it first thing in the morning. The letters are hard to take out for her little fingers but she does not mind it. Also, I have a baby girl around 4 month and she engages as well because of the colors. It’s easy for her to hold the letter in her hand. Makes perfect sister activity for us! love it.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Alaverdova

customer_reviews.title: xmas gift for my twin boys
customer_reviews.text: i bought 2 of these so that my 2.5 year old twins wouldn’t fight over 1 set. instead they fight over both sets. they both love the abc’s and use them multiple times per day.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cvanciger

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not come in original packaging. Looks used!!!! Buy it in store if you can!
customer_reviews.author: P. Gines

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to carry around for your little ones
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter and she surely loves it. At first I thought it was battery operated but it just comes with the letters and you get to place them where they belong. Perfect for teaching little ones the ABC'S. She gets to carry it around everywhere we go due to being in a good hard case.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter does love this because it is Elmo, but wish for this price it did more. This is simply plastic letters that snap in a case. The case is crazy hard to open. There is no way a small child could get it open. The letters loose some of their shape due to the cutout for ease of taking them out.
customer_reviews.author: Ren Fam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t make noise and don’t lose any letters
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it’s great that it’s Sesame Street. However, it does t make any noise and I did lose the letter N. I think if I could I’d give it 3.5 stars. Better than a 3 not quite a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Krey918

customer_reviews.title: Classic Set
customer_reviews.text: This was must have for my two year old, he watched the YouTube video over 100 times and it was great to see his expression when he got to own it, he loves holding it playing with it all the time. I was little frustrated that this item didn’t arrive on time due to its great demand.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Very cute!
customer_reviews.text: My 19 month old loves this toy! He is able to pop the letters in and out fairly easily. It’s very colorful which he loves and it doesn’t make noise which is a huge plus!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be easier to use
customer_reviews.text: Great for toddler learning letters but it is very hard to get the letters in and out of the box. I as an adult have a hard time, so it’s really frustrating on a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to gift for 1 year olds. My son learned all his letters by the time he turned 2. He still loves to play with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret M.

customer_reviews.title: Sesame Street Elmo's /Learn To Spell
customer_reviews.text: No dislike, Came brand new. Packeged nicely. The last one I had lasted almost 4 years. Very tough, well made. I hope this one is as good as the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Evans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 2 year old grandson!
customer_reviews.text: He loves it! Totally loves it! You will have to help pop out some of the letters with the younger toddlers, but so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: George Moreau

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 20 month old daughter because she is obsessed with Elmo and the alphabet. Lol This definitely keeps her entertained for awhile. The letters were a little stiff at first but, the seem to have loosened up a bit over time. The only issue we have is; my daughter can’t open it on her own. Which isn’t a big deal. We love this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for Sesame Street fans
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old and 4 year old love this toy. Good for a toddler's fine motor skills and good for a preschoolers budding language skills. My only complaint is that our case is rather hard to open.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Brauer

customer_reviews.title: Hard for a child to open on their own.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! My 3yr old and 1yr old play with it all the time. You really can't break it even if you tried. It is a little hard to open atleast for a 3yr old anyway. The letters really click in very good. I would buy this again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: My daughter LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: My two year old absolutely loves this toy! She likes doing her letters and I like the space at the bottom as we are introducing sight words so we can spell short words like cat and dog. Cute toy and I love the portability.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old is completely obsessed with this and the Cookie Monster Numbers Case. She takes them out multiple times every day and has to bring one wherever we go. I’d highly recommend to anyone looking for a way to help little ones learn/practice/get acquainted with the alphabet, counting and colors. The ONLY critique I have is that some of the pieces are hard for tiny 2 year old fingers to pop out, so someone needs to help with that, but I’m still rating it a 5 because it’s still awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley F

customer_reviews.title: Good product but missing letters
customer_reviews.text: The product is really good for toddlers. Very engaging and safe. Letters are big enough that it is not a choking hazard. Unlike the wood ones you can get. The reason for 2 stars are missing letters.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenixmayo

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for two year olds!
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves this toy and I’m impressed how quickly he learned where all the letters go! Couple of cons... the case is difficult to open, he definitely can’t open it himself. Letters come out completely and are easy to lose. Wish the company offered an option to replace letters!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my 16 month old and she loves them. I love that the letter come in a case. The case makes them easy to find and store. My child also loves carrying the case around. Only thing I dislike is that the letters can be hard to get out of their individual holders. My 16mo struggles to get them out as they have little things that keep the letters in place.
customer_reviews.author: Keness W

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this and has learned to identify her letters since buying it a couple weeks ago. Simple yet nice.
customer_reviews.author: urserenity52

customer_reviews.title: great gift loved by my Autistic Granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, keeps the letters together...Granddaughter is autistic and she is really into Sesame Street and letters
customer_reviews.author: Ellen C. Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo loves playing with these letters, just wish the case wasn't so darn tricky to open! (He brings it to me to open for him when he wants to play.) Still a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: ABC learning ease...
customer_reviews.text: My two year old grandson knows his whole alphabet because I’d this set, (he is very smart) but still amazing to me....every letter and placement in the case... I had to get two more for one 7mo old and a 3 yr old...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!!
customer_reviews.text: My son is obsessed with Elmo so he was all about this ABC set! They’re pretty sturdy and durable for a rowdy 2.5 year old boy. Pieces are easy to take out and click back in. Such a fun way to learn his ABCs!
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Case is extremely hard to open
customer_reviews.text: Love the case except I can barely pry it open. It takes 2 hands to open and its really hard, my 3 year old grandson can't open it at all. Letters are nice and big and brightly colored.
customer_reviews.author: middletonbrat

customer_reviews.title: Our 2 year old is obsessed
customer_reviews.text: Love this learning toy! It can grow with the child as well. Could start with color identification, letter identification, then starting to spell out words, etc. Love that this is not battery operated with loud noises coming out of it. Easy to clean, great Elmo case for storage. Very happy with this and it keeps our busy toddler engaged.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

product_meta.title: Sesame Street Elmo's On The Go Letters
product_meta.description: Preschoolers will love exploring the alphabet with their favorite Sesame Street characters in Elmo's On the Go Letters! Snap each letter into place, or mix them up to spell out simple words in the bottom window. Underneath each letter is an image of a word that starts with that letter. When play is done, fold up the Elmo carrying case, and take the alphabet on the go!
feature_bullets: Includes 26 letters and fold-up carry case

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,253 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
